Question
========

Suppose the independent probability that three individuals *A*, *B* and *C* will be alive in 30 years are still alive is equal to 0.4; 0.3 and 0.5, respectively. What then is the probability that in 30 years only one of the three will be alive?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,06
* 0,09
* 0,21
* 0,44

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.06: Incorrect
* 0.09: Incorrect
* 0.21: Incorrect
* 0.44: Correct
